newsitem.title: JAPAN: Canadian prime minister arrives in Japan.
newsitem.headline: Canadian prime minister arrives in Japan.

text.p: Canadian Prime Minister Jean Chretien arrived in Japan on Tuesday for a five-day official visit.

During his stay, Chretien is to meet Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto, Emperor Akihito and business leaders, and visit Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd's assembly plant for aircraft and rockets in Nagoya, central Japan.
Chretien and Hashimoto were expected to discuss ways to strengthen bilateral ties and U.N. peace-keeping operations, Japanese officials said.
Chretien said on Monday that military intervention may still be needed to save hungry Rwandan refugees in eastern Zaire but that a force as small as 1,000 people could be enough.

"My view is we have to be ready for a military intervention. We are not sure how much of it is needed," Chretien told a news conference in Manila after a one-day summit of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum.
The Canadian prime minister had planned to visit Japan in November last year but called off the visit due to a referendum on Quebec's independence.
